title: N.H. woman indicted for allegedly distributing ‘animal crush’ videos
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lynn Seymour, 51, from Manchester, N.H., indicted for distributing animal cruelty videos, arrested after federal charges.
Prosecutors allege Seymour managed online groups for 'animal crush' videos showing animal torture and abuse.
Seymour faces up to 7 years for distribution and 5 years for conspiracy, with $250,000 fines possible.

title: Tom Brady talks Netflix roast, ‘most rewarding’ Super Bowl win on Kevin Hart’s ‘Cold as Balls’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tom Brady appeared on Kevin Hart's 'Cold as Balls' to discuss Super Bowl victories and recent activities.
Brady named his Buccaneers' Super Bowl win as the 'most rewarding' and shared a cordial recent encounter with Bill Belichick.
Brady enjoyed Netflix's 'The Roast of Tom Brady,' despite concerns about its impact on his children.

title: What issues are most important to you in the Boston mayoral, City Council election?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Preliminary elections on Sept. 9 will decide which mayoral and City Council candidates advance to the Nov. 4 general election.
Boston residents prioritize housing affordability, public safety, immigration policies, and infrastructure in upcoming mayoral and City Council elections.
Residents express concerns about high rent and safety issues, particularly around Mass and Cass affecting voting decisions.

title: Mass. has one of the best nude beaches in the U.S., according to CNN
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Moshup Beach on Martha's Vineyard is listed as one of the top nude beaches in the U.S. by CNN.
The beach features clothing-optional and clothing-required areas, situated near Aquinnah village's multicolored clay cliffs.
Visitors can explore nearby attractions like the historic Gay Head Lighthouse and Aquinnah Cultural Center.

title: Driving school manager gets prison time for passing unqualified drivers in State Police license fraud scheme
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Scott Camara, 44, sentenced to one month in federal prison in State Police license fraud scheme.
Camara pleaded guilty to perjury, conspiracy in scheme to bypass CDL skills tests for four applicants.
Prosecutors sought a 10-month sentence; Camara's limited role, lack of record urged for lesser sentence.

title: Red Sox reportedly calling up pitching prospect for MLB debut, sending Dustin May to IL
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox prospect Connelly Early to debut Tuesday against the Athletics, called up after promotions from Double A and Triple A.
Pitcher Dustin May placed on Injured List as Early joins Red Sox; May is 1-4 with a 5.40 ERA since joining.
Early, a 2023 fifth-round pick, holds a 10-3 record with a 2.60 ERA and 132 strikeouts across minor leagues in 2025.

title: Mass. teen facing assault with dangerous weapon charges in road rage incident near high school
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 19-year-old was charged in a road rage incident near Dedham High School, unrelated to the school itself.
Police responded to Whiting Avenue after reports of a fight; one person had a hand laceration treated at the scene.
The suspect is charged with assault with a dangerous weapon and malicious damage to a motor vehicle.

title: Report: Jabrill Peppers signs with the Steelers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jabrill Peppers, released by the Patriots, signed with the Pittsburgh Steelers after DeShon Elliott's knee injury.
Peppers spent three seasons with the Patriots and will face them at Gillette Stadium on September 21.
Last season, Peppers played six games, battled injuries, and faced legal issues before being acquitted.

title: Live results: 2025 Boston mayoral preliminary election
author: John Waller
bullets: Boston's mayoral preliminary election will narrow four candidates to two finalists.
Candidates include incumbent Mayor Michelle Wu, Josh Kraft, Robert Cappucci, and Domingos DaRosa.
Mayor Michelle Wu leads with a significant 50-point advantage over challenger Josh Kraft.

title: Survey says Mass. is happy, but not TOO happy. How about you?
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Massachusetts ranked ninth happiest state in the U.S. by WalletHub, above New York (16th) and Kentucky (43rd).
State scored sixth in 'Work Environment' and eighth in 'Emotional & Physical Well-Being'.
Vermont ranked 29th, with a high adult depression rate despite leading in 'Adequate-Sleep Rate'.
